chapter_title: 8. Hence that general is skillful in attack whose oppo-
claims: A general is skillful in attack if their opponent does not know what to defend.
A general is skillful in defense if their opponent does not know what to attack.
rules: Ensure the safety of your defense by holding positions that cannot be attacked.
Advance and be absolutely irresistible by attacking the enemy's weak points.
Retire safely from pursuit by moving more rapidly than the enemy.
Force an enemy into engagement even if they are sheltered behind a high rampart and deep ditch by attacking another place they must relieve.
Prevent the enemy from engaging you even if your encampment lines are merely traced out on the ground by throwing something odd and unaccountable in their way.
